CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 17, 1950, pg. 14, reads: "New Bakery Salesman - Marshall Minnis, 1803 Centre Avenue, veteran employe [employee] of the United Baking Company for the past thirteen years, was recently transferred to the sales and delivery department of the baking company and given a truck route in the Hill District. He serves stores and eating places in the Hill District. He is the first Negro driver employed by the company and welcomes your patronage. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Bakery salesman Marshall Minnis standing in front of United Baking Company truck
